body: @blizzz

i thought about, maybe i have to get smb running on all my systems at command line first. actual looks like everything works fine except creating files on my windows computer if using the smbclient on my linux machine.

error:
smb: \> echo test > file.txt
echo failed: nt_status_io_timeout
smb: \>

just wanted you to know that i'm trying to get this working to see if its a real oc problem or not...

is smbclient installed?

@icewind1991

yeah, smbclient is installed and this nt_status_io_timeout just appears if i try to create a file on the commandline smb: >.

i did some tests like: sharing a folder on my opensuse and tried to get this folder on my win7-machine. works. iam able to do everything (create, delete, rename, move, copy files and directorys). then i tried this the other way round. sharing a folder on my win7-machine and tried to get this folder on my opensuse. there is this problem too. it seems like i cannot create any files. i can rename, edit, delete and copy directorys, but i cannot create any files.

in oc i'm only able to delete files, rename folder and files (here comes an error up to but the file/folder got already renamed). if i click delete file the interface doesn't change until i did a reload but the file is already deleted.
i ask on the forum for help too - looks like noone else can help ^^ -  but anyway here the link, some other people got the same and maybe it could help: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=9211&p=22636#p22636

while researching, i found this: https://bugzilla.samba.org/show_bug.cgi?id=8498 ...

i got smb running on terminal now. i didnt knew that files can only get 'put' via samba.

i guess in oc this works like creating a file local and then putting them on the samba share and delete this local file. maybe there could be a problem?

i have exactly the same problem. is there any progress on this topic? would much appreciate help. 

@yaerox: have you been able to solve your issue? if so could you please post your solution. thx!

unfotunately not :/

i'm waiting too if someone will be able to fix this ... like i said in my last posts, i got smb running on terminal and i could imagine maybe something on the oc scripts which maybe work like i "ask" (i guess in oc this works like creating a file local and then putting them on the samba share and delete this local file) could be the problem.

wanna use oc since v 4.0.7 but actual never got this running, but this is the feature which make me sticking on oc ^^

edit: i keep this tab and the irc chat always opened to see if anything happens ;)

hello, i have a similar problem, but in my setup, it's the creation of directory that didn't work with the windows client sync.
same log message.
any files directly at the root of my local sync dir are correctly copy on the external storage.
but if i add a sub dir, the sync stop, and nothing is copy on the external storage, and on the oc webui, a file with the name of my subdir appear and cannot be deleted.
does someone know if this is maybe fixed in 5.0.4 ? couldn't find anything similiar in the changelogs.
we did the upgrade to 5.0.4 but still the same issue. :-( it's a shame since owncloud is not usable for our needs as long as this malfunction is not fixed...
same here, we were already in oc 5.0.4 when i post my last comment.

for me this looks like, if no user will try to understand the smb.php and all depending files and get a look on the functions and how they work, nothing will change here :/

unfortunately don't have that much time and knowledge in php (only a beginner :/).
/push

smb-mount

### expected behaviour
be able to create files/folders and even be able to delete them.

### actual behaviour
- can't create files
- after deleting a file the view don't get refreshed (but the file got deleted)
- can't delete folders

### steps to reproduce
1. login to your cloud
2. administration
3. external storage -> smb -> fill the inputs
4. create/delete files/folders

### server configuration
operating system: opensuse 12.1
web server: apache2
database: sqlite
php version: 5.x
owncloud version: 5.0.6 (but like a few times said now, got this since 4.0.7)

### client configuration
browser: firefox / chrome
operating system: windows 7 professional (x86)

### logs
#### web server error log
warning php stat(): stat failed for smb://username:password@computername/smb/testfile at 
/srv/www/htdocs/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/smb.php#65

warning php filetype(): lstat failed for smb://username:password@computername/smb/testfile at 
/srv/www/htdocs/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/streamwrapper.php#33

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1369302383}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1369302383}
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1369302383}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1369314588}
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1369314588}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/username:password@computername\/smb\/testfile at \/srv\/www\/htdocs\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1369314588}

### sharing of local and smb mounted folders/files:
folders which should get shared get corrupt foldernames on the shared accounts. it looks like the folder name are like whitespace and caused by this if two folders getting shared u got like whitespace (2)
no write rights on shared folders doesn't matter if i checked just everything (full rights) or not.
doesn't show any files

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
yes, i encounter all above mentioned issues with oc 5.0.17.
@ostasevych i guess 5.0.17 is the latest beta release?
@icewind1991 can you please have a look at this? looks like users have this issue for a quite long time. thx
i got some free time and tried oc 5.0.10. like ostasevych said, all above mentioned issues still there in oc 5.0.10.

i'm also experiencing the same issue. 

i use an smb mount via the external storage plug-in and all of my desktop clients are osx clients. when i first installed owncloud, everything transferred fine to the clients (50 gb of data)... the issue popped up when one of the clients moved a folder containing some small files and sub-directories from his desktop to the owncloud folder. the logs on the server started to fill up with lstat, stat, and filename errors. i created the top level directory on the owncloud server and as soon as i did that, the files started to copy in to it but not the sub-directories. i went through and created those by hand as well and when i did files started to copy over until everything was there. once all the issues were fixed with this directory it then synced the files to the other osx clients.

edit:

i'm connecting to a linux samba server and not a real windows server (just an fyi)

### expected behaviour
i should be able to delete folders at the root of my smb share
moving/renaming files and folders shouldn't give error messages even if the operations are successful

### actual behaviour
i can't delete folders at the root of the smb share, only sub-folders
moving or renaming anything produces an error even tho refreshing the page proves that it completed successfully

### steps to reproduce
1. go to your smb share folder
2. create folders and files
3. try and delete them/rename them/move them

### server configuration
operating system: ubuntu 12.0.4.2

web server: apache2

database: mysql

php version: 5.0.3

owncloud version: 5.0.10

### client configuration
browser: chrome

operating system: windows 7

### logs
#### web server error log
```
none
```

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/folder\/ at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1378303287}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/folder\/  at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1378303287}
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/folder\/  at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1378303287}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/folder\/  at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1378303287}
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/folder\/ at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1378303287}
{"app":"php","message":"filetype(): lstat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/other_folder%2ffile.txt at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/streamwrapper.php#33","level":2,"time":1378303440}
{"app":"php","message":"stat(): stat failed for smb:\/\/xxxxxxxxxx%5cxxxxxxx:xxxxxxxx@xx.x.xx.xxx\/xxxxxx\/other_folder%2ffile.txt at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/apps\/files_external\/lib\/smb.php#65","level":2,"time":1378303440}
```

#### browser log
```
xhr finished loading: "https:/xyz.net/owncloud/index.php/apps/files/ajax/delete.php". 
```

oh hey

the smb thingie is running 'del' to delete folders, that might be an issue, no? if i change it to rmdir, it suddently works...
@icewind1991 thx

i read the latest changelog:
- fix issues with certain file names like 0 or false
- disable smb in files_external on windows servers

does this tell us you're working on this thing?

hi,

i can reproduce this issue on last stable (5.0.11 at this time).
i see this error message even if i just try to browse my smb share.
@icewind1991 can you please have a look at this? thx
anyone already tried 5.0.12 ?

the delete and stat issues are addressed in this pr: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5893

deleting a folder, as someone pointed, is using "del" which is wrong. will be addressed here: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/4531
most issues seem to be related to the broken stat: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5778
